comments.body: What is the ultimate plan for methods like this one that is 100% identical between PG and H2. Wouldn't it be better to move it into the common implementation and let it be overridden only when necessary?
Note that it's not 100% identical, because `arrayIntersectionWhereClause` is different for PG and H2.
right, but that could be solve by making the method abstract in the common implementation

yeah there is room for improvement here definitely, let's see how this looks after the first pass of oracle integration, and let's improve from there. template methds in a common-trait works, although is not my favorite, after we have all the code we can figure something nice I am sorue
also here is another dimension of improvment: squashing lots of event query methods to one, that would ultimately shrink the interface itself as well (as everywhere what implements it)

The parsing logic seems a non-trivial string logic, how about:
- having a more streamlined signature to the pure function like def extractUserPasswordAndRemoveFromUrl(jdbcUrl: String): (String, Option[String], Option[String]) // (clensedUrl, foundUser, foundPassword)
- having some simple unit tests to guard the pure function
Here is a preview of what that looks like (as part of follow-up): https://github.com/digital-asset/daml/compare/with-tests-h2-storage-backend-separate-user-and-password-from-url?expand=1
